segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 47
segments.en: Linked Discourses 47

segments.pli: 2. Nālandavagga
segments.en: 2. At Nālandā

segments.pli: 14. Ukkacelasutta
segments.en: 14. At Ukkacelā

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vajjīsu viharati ukkacelāyaṃ gaṅgāya nadiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṃ aciraparinibbutesu sāriputtamoggallānesu.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Vajjīs near Ukkacelā on the bank of the Ganges river, together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants. It was not long after Sāriputta and Moggallāna had become fully extinguished.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhusaṅghaparivuto ajjhokāse nisinno hoti.
segments.en: Now, at that time the Buddha was sitting in the open, surrounded by the Saṅgha of monks.

segments.pli: Atha kho bhagavā tuṇhībhūtaṃ bhikkhusaṃghaṃ anuviloketvā bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: Then the Buddha looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were silent. He addressed them:

segments.pli: “api myāyaṃ, bhikkhave, parisā suññā viya khāyati parinibbutesu sāriputtamoggallānesu.
segments.en: “Mendicants, this assembly seems empty to me now that Sāriputta and Moggallāna have become fully extinguished.

segments.pli: Asuññā me, bhikkhave, parisā hoti, anapekkhā tassaṃ disāyaṃ hoti, yassaṃ disāyaṃ sāriputtamoggallānā viharanti.
segments.en: When Sāriputta and Moggallāna were alive, my assembly was never empty; I had no concern for any region where they stayed.

segments.pli: Ye hi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṃ atītamaddhānaṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesampi bhagavantānaṃ etapparamaṃyeva sāvakayugaṃ ahosi—
segments.en: The Buddhas of the past or the future have pairs of chief disciples who are no better than

segments.pli: seyyathāpi mayhaṃ sāriputtamoggallānā.
segments.en: Sāriputta and Moggallāna were to me.

segments.pli: Yepi te, bhikkhave, bhavissanti anāgatamaddhānaṃ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesampi bhagavantānaṃ etapparamaṃyeva sāvakayugaṃ bhavissati—seyyathāpi mayhaṃ sāriputtamoggallānā.
Acchariyaṃ, bhikkhave, sāvakānaṃ, abbhutaṃ, bhikkhave, sāvakānaṃ.
segments.en: It’s an incredible and amazing quality of such disciples

segments.pli: Satthu ca nāma sāsanakarā bhavissanti ovādappaṭikarā, catunnañca parisānaṃ piyā bhavissanti manāpā garubhāvanīyā ca.
segments.en: that they fulfill the Teacher’s instructions and follow his advice. And they’re liked and approved, respected and admired by the four assemblies.

segments.pli: Acchariyaṃ, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa, abbhutaṃ, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa.
segments.en: And it’s an incredible and amazing quality of the Realized One

segments.pli: Evarūpepi nāma sāvakayuge parinibbute natthi tathāgatassa soko vā paridevo vā.
segments.en: that when such a pair of disciples becomes fully extinguished he does not sorrow or lament.

segments.pli: Taṃ kutettha, bhikkhave, labbhā. Yaṃ taṃ jātaṃ bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ palokadhammaṃ, taṃ vata mā palujjīti—
segments.en: How could it possibly be so that what is born, created, conditioned, and liable to fall apart should not fall apart?

segments.pli: netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: That is not possible.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato ye mahantatarā khandhā te palujjeyyuṃ;
segments.en: Suppose there was a large tree standing with heartwood, and the largest branch fell off.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, mahato bhikkhusaṃghassa tiṭṭhato sāravato sāriputtamoggallānā parinibbutā.
segments.en: In the same way, in the great Saṅgha that stands with heartwood, Sāriputta and Moggallāna have become fully extinguished.

segments.pli: Taṃ kutettha, bhikkhave, labbhā. Yaṃ taṃ jātaṃ bhūtaṃ saṅkhataṃ palokadhammaṃ, taṃ vata mā palujjīti—
segments.en: How could it possibly be so that what is born, created, conditioned, and liable to fall apart should not fall apart?

segments.pli: netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: That is not possible.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhave, attadīpā viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.
segments.en: So mendicants, be your own island, your own refuge, with no other refuge. Let the teaching be your island and your refuge, with no other refuge.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attadīpo viharati attasaraṇo anaññasaraṇo, dhammadīpo dhammasaraṇo anaññasaraṇo?
segments.en: And how does a mendicant do this?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ;
segments.en: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: vedanāsu … pe …
segments.en: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …

segments.pli: citte … pe …
segments.en: mind …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ.
segments.en: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu attadīpo viharati attasaraṇo anaññasaraṇo, dhammadīpo dhammasaraṇo anaññasaraṇo.
segments.en: That’s how a mendicant is their own island, their own refuge, with no other refuge. That’s how the teaching is their island and their refuge, with no other refuge.

segments.pli: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, etarahi vā mamaccaye vā attadīpā viharissanti attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā; tamatagge mete, bhikkhave, bhikkhū bhavissanti ye keci sikkhākāmā”ti.
segments.en: Whether now or after I have passed, any who shall live as their own island, their own refuge, with no other refuge; with the teaching as their island and their refuge, with no other refuge—those mendicants of mine who want to train shall be among the best of the best.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: After the passing of Sāriputta and Moggallāna (whose actual death is unrecorded in the canon), the Buddha says the Saṅgha looks empty; yet he is not sad.
